abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times spot interesting items on the Web each day. Today’s discoveries include South Korea’s tech regulations, Verizon data plans and a flatbed scanner that outplays The Animals.
snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times spot interesting items on the Web each day. Today’s discoveries include South Korea’s tech regulations, Verizon data plans and a flatbed scanner that outplays The Animals.
lead_paragraph: Fascinating tidbits that Bits reporters and editors found on the Web. Like them? There are more here.

headline.main: Today’s Scuttlebot: Regulating Games and Musical Scanners
